extendedIngredients.name: tilapia fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 4 (6-ounce) tilapia fillets, cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: tilapia fillets, cut in half lengthwise

title: Panko Pan-Fried Fish Strips
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Panko Pan-Fried Fish Strips a try. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.41 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 39g of protein, 10g of fat, and a total of 318 calories. Head to the store and pick up salt, garlic powder, olive oil, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the panko you could follow this main course with the Panko Crusted Brownie Pie as a dessert. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 20 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 78%. This score is pretty good. Try Panko Panfried Fish Strips, Panko-Crusted Oven-"Fried" Fish, and Baked Panko Chicken Strips for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Loveblock Pinot Gris with a 4.6 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Loveblock Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Loveblock Pinot Gris is a pale golden with hints of green. The 2013 vintage is a dry style with floral aromas and a hint of ripe pineapple. The palate reveals poached pear and blood orange, and finishes with a touch of citrus, good texture and rich mouth feel.

instructions: Combine first 3 ingredients; sprinkle evenly over fish.                                                                                                 Place buttermilk in a shallow dish. Place panko in another shallow dish. Working with 1 piece of fish at a time, dip fish into buttermilk, and dredge in panko.                                                                                                 Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of oil to pan; add half of fish. Reduce heat to medium; cook 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Repeat procedure with remaining oil and fish.                                                                                                Serve with: Dijon Green Beans

steps.step: Combine first 3 ingredients; sprinkle evenly over fish.
Place buttermilk in a shallow dish.
Place panko in another shallow dish. Working with 1 piece of fish at a time, dip fish into buttermilk, and dredge in panko.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half of oil to pan; add half of fish. Reduce heat to medium; cook 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Repeat procedure with remaining oil and fish.
